- Location: Column 1
- Date: Probably Trajan 
- [Hieroglyphic Text](https://www.ifao.egnet.net/uploads/publications/enligne/Temples-Esna003.pdf#page=60){target="_blank"}

<div class="col2">  

^26^ *ȝbd šmw 3 hrw 20  *  
*ḥb ṯȝy ʿwn.t  *  
*nty ḥb qn n ẖnmw  *  
*ḫr.tw r=f  *  
   
*dwȝ n sḫʿ *  
*ḥqȝ mnỉ.w  *  
^27^ *ḥȝ.t m ʿḥȝ nfr  *  
*ỉr m-stỉ nt   *  
*ẖnmw-Rʿ nb tȝ-sn.t  *  
*ẖnmw-Rʿ nb sḫ.t  *

^26^ III Shomu 20 (= [Epiphi 20](https://bookdown.org/shemanefer/Esna2/calendar-ii-77.html#epiphi-20))  
Festival of Taking the Baton,[^fn-198-1]  
i.e. Victory Festival of Khnum,  
as it is also called.  
  
The morning of the procession  
of the Ruler of Herdsmen.[^fn-198-2]  
^27^ Beginning of the good battle  
performed in the sight of  
Khnum-Re Lord of Esna,  
and Khnum-Re Lord of the Field.  
 
</div>

[^fn-198-1]: For this festival and the battle against Khnum's enemies, see @sauneron-5, pp. 355-378.
[^fn-198-2]: The present text is repeated in [Esna 259], 1, which continues with many more details of this festival.
